AttackerCapabilities: Knowledge of RFC5322 validation for email addresses
Understanding of Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) vulnerabilities

Vulnerabilities: SSTI vulnerability in the email parameter
SecurityMeasures: Validation of alphanumeric characters for name parameter

Steps.Description: Exploiting the RFC5322 validation for the email parameter

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that the email parameter can be manipulated to bypass the RFC5322 validation.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker crafts a payload that includes a domain-literal format in the email parameter, allowing them to inject arbitrary HTML code.
StepDetails.Result: The payload successfully injects HTML code into the email parameter, bypassing the RFC5322 validation.

Steps.Description: Exploiting the SSTI vulnerability in the email parameter

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that the email parameter is vulnerable to SSTI and can be used to execute arbitrary code.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker crafts a payload that utilizes SSTI to read the 'flag.txt' file on the server.
StepDetails.Result: The payload successfully executes the code and reads the contents of the 'flag.txt' file.
